intro: Calandrinia cephalophora, commonly known as the "pink rockrose," is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in rocky or arid environments. The plant produces small, showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Calandrinia cephalophora is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive flowers and drought tolerance.
